thread.title: High school football: Glenbard South wins big against Aurora Central Catholic
thread.title_full: High school football: Glenbard South wins big against Aurora Central Catholic

title: High school football: Glenbard South wins big against Aurora Central Catholic
text:
High school football: Glenbard South wins big against Aurora Central Catholic Published: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 1:17 a.m. CDT Caption (Photo provided by Brian Hill/bhill@dailyherald.com) Glenbard South celebrates a big play on Oct. 9 during a home game against Aurora Central Catholic. Sean Cooke ran wild as the Raiders won 42-0 against the Chargers. By SUBURBAN LIFE MEDIA 
GLEN ELLYN â€“ Sean Cooke picked up right where he left off. 
After rushing for more than 300 yards and seven touchdowns in a blowout win against Wheaton Academy last time out, the Glenbard South junior running back scored the first two Raider touchdowns in a 42-0 win against Aurora Central Catholic on Oct. 9. 
Cooke finished with 202 yards rushing, including a 51-yard score in the third quarter to make it a 28-0 game. 
Javonis Hawkins had a 30-yard scoring run in the fourth quarter to initiate the running clock for South, which improved to 5-2 overall and 3-0 in the Metro Suburban West. 
Hawkins had 97 yards rushing. 
Glenbard South faces host IC Catholic on Oct. 17 in a matchup of the two front runners in the Metro Suburban West. Both teams are 3-0 in the league.
